item.title: Report E-2024100148
item.description:
Report E-2024100148

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-04
  • City: RICHLAND
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a release of hazardous product, SulfaTrap R7J from a supersac. The supersac was punctured by a piece of pallet. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 5lb release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 4’x2’ area. The supersac was transferred into two flex-bins that will ship on to the Consignee. One drums of waste was generated containing the released product, impacted PPE, cardboard and the damaged supersac. XPO will manage all of the waste from this No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report X-2024100359
item.description:
Report X-2024100359

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-02
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/2/2024 at approximately 1245, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 393838 at the ramp facility in Fort Worth, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box that contained 4 glass bottles of petroleum crude oil. The package was damaged by mechanical equipment, resulting in one of the glass bottles breaking and spilling. There is no secondary containment or positive closure. The cushioning between the bottles was insufficient. The broken glass and damaged outer package were placed in a salvage drum for proper disposal and the remaining bottles were placed in a separate drum, awaiting an amended Shipper's Declaration for futher transport.

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-02
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a release of hazardous product, K-Kleen SP. A contractor was dispatched and observed approximately 2-gallons released from one 55-gallon DF that fell over during transit due to improper blocking and bracing. An estimated 12’x6’ area of the wooden trailer floor was impacted and oil dry was applied. The damaged drum was overpacked into one 85-gallon DF along with the impacted oil dry. XPO will manage all of the waste generated from this response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding the release of hazardous product, WRXSOL-ECO-CR from a 330-gallon tote. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 10-gallon release from a crack in the tote that impacted the inside of the trailer (floors and walls) in a 10’x8.5’ area. The contractor neutralized the impacted area using backing soda and performed a tote transfer. The damaged tote was neutralized and taken for disposal by the Contractor. No other waste was generated from this response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

JT stated the pallet looks to have become unstable and fell over during transit causing a one 5 gallon pail to become damaged on the botto m of the pallet. JT stated the damaged pail looks to have been crushed causing a spill of 64oz of the UN1760, CORROSIVE LIQUIDS, N.O.S on the trailer floor. JT stated one of the dock workers started to re stack the pallet on a new skid and JT advised he told the dock worker to stop work and he was g oing to call the spill into safety. JT stated the spill was made possible from improper blocking embracing.~

  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, WE DISCOVERED ONE STEEL DRUM DAMAGED AND LEAKING. THE DRUM WAS FULLY MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1993 FLAMMABLE LIQUID NOS WITH AN IATA SHIPPERS DECLARATION. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION THERE IS A HOLE IN THE TOP OF THE STEEL DRUM AND THE SIDES OF THE DRUM ARE DENTED FROM UNKNOWN SOURCES. APPROXIMATELY 3 L OF THE 13.6 L QUANTITY LEAKED FROM THE DRUM. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT X61148, ADHESIVE SYSTEMS, 9411 CORSAIR RD FRANKFORT IL 60423.

  • State: CA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 25, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN2693 was damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and tote exterior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the impacted site. The crew patched the damaged tote and wrapped it. AS personnel utilized neutralizers, absorbents, and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted absorbents were containerized in one (1) 5-gallon pail. On September 30, 2024, the crew returned to perform a tote transfer. The damaged tote and all cleanup debris were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums and staged onsite.

item.description:
Report X-2024100355

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-24
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 12 HOUR RESPONDER REBOXING PKGS THAT WERE WET FROM A LEAKER THAT WAS AT DOOR 35 IN THE UNLOAD. RESPONDER OPENED THE PKG, REMOVED THE FIRST OF THE TWO UNDAMAGED BOXES, AND NOTICED THAT THERE WAS A CLASS 1.4S EXPLOSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL ON THE SIDE OF THE INNER CARTON. RESPONDER REALIZED THAT THE PKG WAS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT, AND THE SHIPMENT WAS PHONED INTO HMSC. OUTER CARTON WET ON THE BOTTOM, BUT THE 2 BOXES CONTAINING THE PRODUCT WERE UNDAMAGED.

item.title: Report X-2024100353
item.description:
Report X-2024100353

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-24
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS RESPONDED TO BY DESIGNATED RESPONDER AFTER A CALL WAS RECEIVED FROM THE PD1 OUTBOUND SUPERVISOR. PACKAGE WAS BEING PREPARED FOR LOADING WHEN INTERIOR CONTENTS OF THE PACKAGE (AIR BAG), DEPLOYED INSIDE BOX. A CORNER OF THE PACKAGE CAUGHT FIRE AND WAS IMMEDIATELY PUT OUT BY THE AREA SUPERVISOR, ALL EVENTS OCCURING BEFORE DESIGNATED RESPONDERS HAD BEEN ALERTED. PACKAGE WAS RETRIEVED AND BROUGHT BACK TO DMP. H S SUPERVISOR, BASE SUPERVISOR, AND SORT MANAGER WERE ALERTED TO THE EVENT. PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED TO FIND THE STEERING COLUMN WITH AIR BAG DEPLOYED, NO INTERIOR PACKAGING, NO EXTERNAL HAZARDOUS MARKINGS, AND WAS PREPARED IN A REUSED FIBERBOARD BOX.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 24, 2024, twelve 1-gallon pails of paint were knocked over by a forklift and released approximately twelve (12) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM-Group (TPM) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. The damaged pails were containerized in one (1) 65-gallon drum. All spent absorbents and debris were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CIRCLE K
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 25000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 500-gallons of gasoline released from one (1) tanker truck due to the driver attempting to switch trailers, but the weight was too heavy, causing the landing gear to go through the bottom of the trailer and the tank fell on the ground. The release impacted the asphalt parking lot and ditch that is in the center of the parking lot. Emergency response contractor HEPACO arrived on site and performed an initial clean up and collected an estimated 11,000 gallons of Liquid waste from the ditch and placed it into a frac-tank. The soil ditch area is pending remediation. No storm drains were reported impacted by the release.

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: PINE BLUFF
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 50000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Train crew witnessed the car release from the top. Code 3, contractor, SRS, and HMM were enroute. Car vented again upon arrival of the contractor. The car was inspected, and the pressure was 275 psi and less than zero on the gauging rod. It was determined that the car was overloaded. Highway transports and residue cars were mobilized to the Pine Bluff yard. The car vented two more times before being reduced to trucks. Car reduced to 14.5" of outage and the pressure was 155.

  • Description: At 0856 ET, XPO terminal LEP notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported approximately 1-gallon of Acetone Isobutyl Isobutyrate released from a total of (3)5-gallon metal pails due to improper loading. The release impacted trailer # 3173004. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. Contractors containerized the (3) damaged pails of Acetone Isobutyl Isobutyrate product to (2) 55-gallon metal drums along with impacted rags. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100145

Report E-2024100145

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-07
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: At 05:26 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal NAT. It was reported approximately 3 gallons of Hydrex 60240 released from a 55-gallon poly drum due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted concrete dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site due to the spill containing Haz Class 8 material. Contractors used absorbents to clean concrete floor, cut up tote, PPE and absorbents were containerized to (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100149
item.description:
Report E-2024100149

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Veolia personnel visited Santa Clara Valley Medical Center to collect various types of universal waste. Among the items were two 5-gallon pails containing lithium-ion batteries. The Veolia team carefully inspected each battery to ensure there was no bulging or damage, and verified that the terminals were properly protected with tape. The following morning, as Veolia employees were unloading waste from a box truck for trans-loading at Veolia's intransit facility, one worker noticed smoke emanating from one of the pails containing lithium-ion batteries. Acting swiftly, the employee removed the smoking 5-gallon pail from the truck and isolated it outdoors. The affected battery was allowed to complete its reaction process safely. Subsequently, the remaining batteries were separated and thoroughly re-examined. As a precautionary measure, each lithium-ion battery was individually bagged, and packed with fire suppressant media. Following this incident, all lithium-ion batteries were treated as damaged or defective and packaged in accordance with the 49 CFR 173.185(f) regulations. The second pail of lithium batteries underwent the same rigorous re-examination and packaging process to ensure safety and compliance.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/5/2024 at approximately 1730, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5028110 at the station location in Stockton, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consists of one metal cylinder packaged in a fiberboard box. The shipment was discovered making a hissing sound. Further investigation revealed the cylinder was accidentally discharging inside of the box. The cause is the discharge is unknown. The shipment was isolated from other packages and is being held pending an FAA investigation.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 38000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At 1739ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release located at terminal XWB. It was reported that an unknown amount of Acid N released from (1) 275-gallon poly tote due to puncture from the metal part of a strap. The release is impacting the trailer floor, is releasing heavily, and starting to leak out onto the concrete yard. Terminal personnel are putting speedy dry around the release to try to contain it. The caller reported the tote is punctured on the side about 4" from the bottom and will be empty by the time a contractor arrives on site. Contractors recovered Acid N product, impacted absorbents, pads, and plastic in (18) 55-gallon poly drums. The drums were staged onsite at the terminal for personnel to handle.

  • Description: At 18:37 EST on 9/4, XPO-XBV contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 1 teaspoon of "NALCO 7341" from a 275-gallon poly tote. The tote had a damaged cap/seal and was prone to spilling in motion. ERTS confirmed the material to be a class 8 corrosive which XPO personnel are not permitted to clean. The contractors impacted and neutralized the NALCO 7341 and containerized waste into (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was placed at the terminal for personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 1700 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal USA. It was reported approximately 5 ounces of BullDog Adhesion Promotor were released from (1) 15-ounce aerosol can, due to improper packaging. The release impacted the box it came in and the other 5 cans in the box. The caller stated the damaged box and cans were placed into a 10-gallon metal drum prior to calling ERTS. The waste was staged in OSD. 216941-1 10-gallon DM contains cardboard and (6) 15-ounce aerosol cans of product.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: Cincinnati
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SUPERIOR ENVIRONMENTAL SOLUTIONS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The driver returned to the facility and was unloading his van trailer of all waste drums and totes. He went to move one of the 275 gallon totes and pulled too far into the tote and the forklift forks struck a drum behind the tote puncturing that drum causing it to leak. The driver as well as our warehouse associates quickly and safely acted to tim the drum on its side to limit the amount of liquid that leaked out- approximately 15 gallons. Speedi dry as well as absorbent pads were placed in the trailer to contain the spill. The drum was placed into and overpack drum and all the solid debris was scooped up and drummed as well.

item.title: Report E-2024100054
item.description:
Report E-2024100054

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T12:22:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-01
  • City: NEW COLUMBIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XMI experienced a UN2815 Aminoethylpiperazine-HP release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 25-gallons of product released to an 8' x 15' area of the trailer floor and a 6' x 28' area of the concrete and asphalt lot below. The drum was punctured by a pallet nail puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents and simple green were then utilized to clean the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents, pallet wood, and cleanup debris were containerized into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: RESPONDER SENT TO A LEAKING HAZMAT IN OB 3, BAY 525. RESPONDER NOTICED 2 LEAKING AND WET PACKAGES, USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO CONTAINERIZE THE PACKAGES AND CLEAN UP THE SPILLED MATERIAL. PACKAGES AND MATERIAL WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. INFORMATION WAS COLLECTED ON ALL SIX SIDES OF BOTHE PACKAGES, SOME LIQUID WAS SOLIDIFIED, AND ALL MATERIAL WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP. THE PRO0CESSED MATERIAL WAS PLACED IN THE UNCONFIRMED DMP STORAGE AREA UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.

item.title: Report E-2024100059
item.description:
Report E-2024100059

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T12:22:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-25
  • City: DIEGEM
  • State:
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5900
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: AN AIR PACKAGE FROM HONG KONG TO BELGIUM WAS DISCOVERED EMITTING SMOKE WHILE TRAVELING ON THE CONVEYOR SYSTEM IN THE UPS DIEGEM BELGIUM FACILITY. THE PACKAGE BEGAN GENERATING HEAVY SMOKE TRIGGERING THE FIRE ALARM SYSTEM AND AN EVACUATION OF THE BUILDING. WHEN THE LOCAL FIRE BRIGADE ARRIVED THE BATTERY EVENT HAD SLOWED DOWN ALLOWING THE PACKAGE TO BE SECURED BY THE FIRE BRIGADE IN A WATER TANK TO PREVENT REACTIVATION OF THE EVENT. THE INCIDENT PACKAGE WAS MARKED AND LABELED AS UN3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES, SECTION IA OF PACKING INSTRUCTION 965. THE PACKAGE HAD AN APPROPRIATE IATA SHIPPERS DECLARATION AND HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT IN HONG KONG. THE PACKAGE WAS REPORTED TO THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER ON SEPTEMBER 25, 2024, UNDER REPORT 1411829.

  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 24, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was damaged in transit and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the UN1263-impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All waste was containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums, and one (1) damaged 55-gallon drum of UN1263 was containerized in one (1) 85-gallon steel over-pack.

  • Description: On September 24, 2024, one (1) 30-gallon drum of tommy's express presoak #1 was damaged by a faulty skid and released approximately three (3) cups of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, and one (1) 30-gallon drum of product was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 23, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of sodium hydroxide solution was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and a neutralizing agent to remediate the impacted trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 30-gallon drums and staged onsite for transport and disposal.

  • Description: During sort operation at the AFWH location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans separated by a fiberboard divider, positive closure rings and packing paper for dunnage. The lid on one can was open spilling the contents. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) quarts of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to improper loading. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel properly cleaned the impacted area and containerized the cleanup debris into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail and the damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 65-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024100048
item.description:
Report E-2024100048

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T12:22:16+00:00

  • City: WEST SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 22, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3214 was shipped with a faulty cap and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and wood pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The one (1) damaged 55-gallon drum was collected and containerized into one (1) 85-gallon overpack for disposal. GES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the trailer floor and worked them in with hand tools. Absorbent pads and cleaners were used to remove all residual product from the impacted surfaces. The impacted wood, spent absorbent pads, spent granular absorbents, and all UN3214 impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon vented poly drum

  • City: Mirabel
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/20/2024 at approximately 1555, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 3871364 at the ramp facility in Mirabel, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of two fiberboard boxes, containing multiple boxes of safety matches. The shipment was flagged and stopped by Customs Clearance based on suspicious x-ray images. Further investigation revealed 250 boxes of matches as inner contents in each box. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, not including the required markings, labeling, packaging, and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately eight (8) ounces of material released from two (2) 1-gallon metal pails due to improper loading. The released material impacted the concrete terminal floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area. The spent absorbents were gathered and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon plastic pail. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • City: LIBERTY
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TRADEBE TRANSPORTATION LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7731
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Friday 7/26/2024 at approximately 1430 a Tradebe Transportation driver, Adrian King was en route to Tradebe Treatment and Recycling in Port Allen, LA with 12 drums from Tradebe Treatment and Recycling in Millington, TN. The driver was flagged by another motorist to pull over because there was liquid coming out of the back of his trailer. The MS Emergency Management Agency was contacted anti a 3rd party emergency response contractor was mobilized to the site. The leaking material was from a turned over drum in transit. After inspecting the leaking drum, it was discovered that a crack was on thE underside of the drum, it appears the bottom was brittle and cracked under the stress of the liquid and transport.

item.title: Report X-2024091857
item.description:
Report X-2024091857

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T00:49:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-21
  • City: WATERLOO
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Chicago Central and Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 20000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Tuesday, May 22, 2024,a CN mechanical performing an inspection observed that the bottom outlet valve appeared to be leaking from tank car # UTLX 211004 along with a strong Ethanol type odor in the area. The employee notified the Transportation Manager who in turn notified the CN Dangerous Goods Team. The tank car was set out to an isolation track (WA90) for inspection by a CN emergency response contractor. A CN emergency responsecontractor was dispatched to thelocation for mitigation.Thecontractor performed an inspection of the tank car and found the bottom outlet valve to be leaking from the threads of the bottom outlet valve cap. It was determined that there was a failure in the sealing surface of the valve seat to include a defective gasket. (The BOV cap was found to be less than tool tight and the BOV in the closed position and pinned upon initial inspection). CN emergency response contractor did observe cable seal to be correctly in place. The BOV cap was removed and it was observed to be leaking past the closed ball. The BOV valve handle was cycled several times to the open and closed position to freeany debris that may have been trapped in the BOV sealing surface potentially causing theleak.The BOV cap was then removed and observed for 20 minutes to ensurethere was no further leakagefrom thevalve. It was noted that the BOV cap gasket was deformed and was replaced. The bottom outlet valve cap was then re-installed and tightened with a 36" pipe wrench. Upon tightening the BOV cap, CN emergency response contractor proceeded to place new cable seals on the BOV / Cap.

item.title: Report E-2024100034
item.description:
Report E-2024100034

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-03T09:21:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-30
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAY experienced a UN2984 Peroxy Foam release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-quart of product released to a 1’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a loose cap on the tote. The cap was tightened, and the tote re-secured for shipment on. The impacted trailer was cleaned with floor dry and pads. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized into a vented 35-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Drum arrived damaged to 030. The Operations Supervisor advised there was a pair of small pin sized holes 6 inches up from the bottom of the drum. There was a small dent around the holes. The cause of the damage was undetermined but may have been from a load shift. The drum was laid on it's side and trailer tape was placed over the holes to stop the drum from leaking. CURA was contacted for remediation.

  • Description: RESPONDER WAS AUDITING THE PACKAGE AND NOTICED IT WAS LEAKING. PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT PROCESSING AREA AND INFORMATION WAS COLLECTED ON ALL SIX SIDES, PACKAGE CONTENTS WAS SOLIDIFIED AND MATERIAL WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP. item.title: Report X-2024100044
item.description:
Report X-2024100044

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-03T09:21:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED BY THE PICKOFF ON THE PD 4. THE PICKOFF STOPED THE BELT, SECURED IT, LOCKED IT, TESTED IT, AND LEFT THE AREA TO NOTIFY HIS SUPERVISOR. WITHIN 5 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. USING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET, THE PACKAGE WAS SAFELY CONTAINED AND IT WAS DETERMINED THAT IT COULD BE TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT TWO OF THE CAPS ON THE INNER 1 GALLON PLASIC CONTAINERS WERE LOOSE BY 1/4 OF A TURN AND 6 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD LEAKED OUT ONTO THE OUTER CARTON WHICH WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX WITH CORRUGATED PARTITIONS.

  • City: ALICEVILLE

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 20, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN3469 were damaged in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha-Omega Training and Compliance, Inc. (AOTC) to remediate the impacted site. AOTC personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and worked them in with hand tools. All UN3469 impacted surfaces were wiped down with absorbent pads. All spent absorbents, pads, and the damaged pails, were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2024100138

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-03T09:21:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER (DR) RECEIVED A CALL TO RETRIEVE A LEAKING PACKAGE. DR BROUGHT THE LEAKING PACKAGE BACK TO THE CENTRAL PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER(PSC)CAGE. DR TRIAGED PACKAGE AND FOUND SEVERAL BOTTLES TO BE LEAKING. DR PLACED A SERVICE CROSS ON THE PACKAGE. A SECOND DR TRIAGED THE LEAKING CONTENTS USING THE WASTE DISPOSAL CHART AND DOWNLOADED THE SAFETY DATA SHEET (SDS). THE SDS SHOWED THIS PRODUCT WAS A CLASS 8 BUT COULD PASS AS LIMITED QUANTITY. AFTER SECOND DR CONFIRMED THE OUTER PACKAGING DID NOT HAVE ANY LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMOND OR ANY HAZARDOUS MARKINGS, THE HAZARDOUS MATERIALS SERVICE CENTER (HMSC) WAS CONTACTED. NATHANIEL AT THE HMSC TOOK THE INFORMATION AND DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS CONSIDERED UNDECLARED.

item.title: Report I-2024090066
item.description:
Report I-2024090066

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-03T09:21:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-12
  • City: Kankakee
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: N&M TRANSFER
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While staged at yard, a leak was detected coming from trailer. Area was isolated and Environmental Restoration LLC was dispatched to perform cleanup. Upon arrival on site, ERLLC applied absorbent material to the free product beneath trailer, and performed trailer inspection. One 55-gallon drum was discovered at nose of trailer, which appeared to be struck by a nail during transit or loading process. ERLLC utilized absorbent material to clean the trailer floor, overpacked the Ieaking drum, and reloaded trailer. Product was scraped from impacted area and containerized with spent absorbent into one 55-gallon drum. Three drums were generated during response. One overpack drum, which contained the damaged drum, one 55-gallon recovery drum with contaminated cardboard, and one 55-gallon drum of spent absorbents, gravel, and poly sheeting. Free product was contained to immediate area and did not threaten to impact state waters. There were no injuries or exposures reported.

item.title: Report E-2024100013
item.description:
Report E-2024100013

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-03T09:21:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 29, 2024 at 0454 ET, an XPO Logistics tractor trailer was exiting I-85 SB onto W.T. Harris Blvd in Charlotte, NC, when the unit rolled over. As a result of the accident (4) 275-gallon poly totes were structurally damaged but still in tact. On September 18, 2024, XPO Logistics in Mississauga, ON notified ERTS of the four totes sitting on their dock needing a transfer. The tote were originally to ship onto the consignee, however the shipper and consignee confirmed the totes needed to be disposed of. ERTS dispatched contractors with specialty totes to complete the transfer of all 4 totes into new ones on September 21, 2024. The crew confirmed there was approximately 1-teaspoon of dried product on the tote body as a result of the roll over accident. All product was successfully transferred from the damaged totes into new ones with no further incident or release. The waste was staged onsite at XPO in Mississauga for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-02T09:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: WEST MIDDLESEX
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Miller Environmental Group was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-1ft area of the concrete dock floor and estimated that one (1) cup of material was released due to a crack in one (1) 330-gallons poly tote. Miller Group personnel transferred the remaining product to a new poly tote and cup up the damaged bladder tote. The cup-up tote and impacted cardboard was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The generate waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: On September 18,2 024, one (1) 2-gallon jug of UN2468 was shipped with faulty packaging and released approximately two (2) cups of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, (HES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews observed a pile of product, cardboard, and product container in between dock doors. HES personnel collected and containerized the contents into one (1) 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090575
item.description:
Report E-2024090575

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-02T09:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-12
  • City: BURTON
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When preparing to transfer containers from rail car it was noticed that 2 of the containers were leaking from the seal at the back door of the box. Absorbent were then put under the leaking areas to contain the release and a response team was called in to address the release. The team needed extra equipment to handle the release and returned at 0830et. at 1015et the containers were removed from the rail car. The team the began adding absorbent to the boxes to absorb any free liquids. The door seals were fixed and the box doors were secured. The clean up was complete at 1530et.

item.title: Report E-2024090589
item.description:
Report E-2024090589

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-02T09:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a release of LIMA-6, from a 275-gallon poly tote. The tote was crushed by other freight due to improper loading. A contractor was dispatched and observed a 0.5-gallon release isolated to the top of the tote. The contractor cleaned-up the release and performed a tote transfer. Four 55-gallon DF’s were generated as waste for disposal containing impacted oil dry, impacted PPE, and cut-up tote pieces. XPO will manage all waste generated from the spill response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.
